meanings.definition: Most untidy or unkempt in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The scraggliest tree in the forest had branches sticking out in all directions.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was the scraggliest at the end of a windy day.
meanings.sent3: The scraggliest scarecrow in the field looked like it had been in a windstorm.
meanings.sent4: The scraggliest bushes in the garden seemed to reach out in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent5: The scraggliest cat in the neighborhood always had fur sticking out in odd angles.

meanings.definition: Having the most irregular or uneven surface.
meanings.sent1: The scraggliest road in town was full of potholes and bumps.
meanings.sent2: The scraggliest piece of wood had knots and rough patches all over.
meanings.sent3: The scraggliest rug in the room kept tripping people with its uneven surface.
meanings.sent4: The scraggliest rock on the beach was worn smooth in some places and jagged in others.
meanings.sent5: The scraggliest sidewalk in the neighborhood was a challenge to walk on without stumbling.

meanings.definition: The most thin or bony in form.
meanings.sent1: The scraggliest of the puppies was always the last to finish eating.
meanings.sent2: The scraggliest of the branches on the tree looked like they might break off.
meanings.sent3: The scraggliest of the pencils in the jar was so small it was hard to hold.
meanings.sent4: The scraggliest of the shadows in the room seemed to stretch and twist unnaturally.
meanings.sent5: The scraggliest of the birds in the flock had trouble keeping up with the others.
